text: Rafael Romero Sandrea (May 22, 1938 – August 15, 2021) was a Venezuelan track and field athlete. He competed in the sprint events. He represented his native country in three Summer Olympics, starting in 1956. Romero won two medals (gold and silver) at the 1963 Pan American Games in Brazil. Romero died on August 15, 2021 at the age of 83.Adiós a otro grande del atletismo sudamericano: Rafael Romero ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Venezuelan sprinters Category:Olympians for Venezuela
title: Rafael Romero
